short_definition: A local law that applies to persons and things subject to the local jurisdiction (a city or county government) as distinguished from a statute, which is a law passed by the state or federal government; ordinances are enacted to regulate zoning, highway speed, parking, refuse disposal and other matters typically or traditionally of local concern.
